issues.details: OpenAIâ€™s CEO warned employees that competition from Googleâ€™s Gemini 3.0 would intensify, urging them not to be shaken.
Benioff publicly claimed that Gemini 3.0 outperforms GPTâ€‘5 in inference speed, image, and video quality, sparking debate over which model truly leads.
Wolf stated that two years ago OpenAI was far ahead, but now the landscape has shifted, implying a loss of dominance.

responses.clarification: Altmanâ€™s memo was a strategic reminder to stay focused, not a sign of imminent collapse.
Benioff clarified that his 2â€‘hour test was a brief trial and not a comprehensive benchmark.

evaluations.opinion: OpenAIâ€™s dominance has eroded; Gemini 3.0 represents a significant shift.
Gemini 3.0 is a breakthrough that will change the AI landscape.
OpenAI faces mounting costs and fierce competition, threatening its market lead.

confirmed_facts: Gemini 3.0 was released by Google in early 2025 and is reported to outperform GPTâ€‘5 in certain metrics.
OpenAIâ€™s dataâ€‘center costs have risen sharply, creating financial pressure.
Googleâ€™s Alphabet stock surged after the Gemini launch.
Sam Altman issued an internal memo warning of intensified competition.
unconfirmed_allegations: Gemini 3.0 is superior across all AI tasks (no independent benchmark yet).
OpenAIâ€™s model training efficiency is significantly lower than Googleâ€™s.

timeline.event: Gemini 3.0 becomes available to the public; mobile app users rise to 6.5â€¯billion.
Sam Altman issues internal memo on competition.
Mark Benioff tweets about Gemini 3.0â€™s performance.
Financial Times publishes article highlighting OpenAIâ€™s crisis.
